# Agile inception

## **What is Agile Inception?**

**"Agile Inception"** refers to a set of activities that align all members of a product team so that common goals can be established.

This concept was introduced by Jonathan Rasmusson in the book **"The Agile Samurai,"** and the set of dynamics helps reduce uncertainty and risks that may exist in a project.
The application of these techniques aims to set common goals, improve communication, and eliminate fears among team members.

It's important to note that it's not necessary to perform all the dynamics; rather, the necessary ones should be carried out to reduce the uncertainty that may exist in the project.

Many times, it is thought that uncertainty is only at the beginning of the project.
Still, as can be seen in the following image from the book "The Agile Samurai," changes can appear during various stages of the project.
This means that dynamics are required to help the team establish common goals and reach agreements.

![Source image: The agile samurai](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1*TXF1eB7s34aoWyBYh4y3eQ.png){style="margin: auto; display: block;"}

## Dynamics

As mentioned earlier, "**Agile Inception**" consists of a set of 10 dynamics that help reduce uncertainty, mitigate risks, and establish common goals within the product development team.

## Why implement Agile Inception?

At the beginning of a project, it is necessary to make decisions in uncertainty, and to do so, it is necessary to:

-   ‚úèÔ∏è Disseminate information to stakeholders so they can make decisions on how to proceed with the project.

These tasks are necessary to be carried out in an organized manner and to ensure that all team members agree on the purpose of the project, how it will be executed, and what the expected results are.
